command: dd if=/boot/initramfs-$(uname -r).img of=/var/tmp/initramfs.cur bs=1M && md5sum /var/tmp/initramfs.cur baseline/initramfs.img && diff -u <(od -An -tx1 -w16 -v /var/tmp/initramfs.cur) <(od -An -tx1 -w16 -v baseline/initramfs.img)
explanation: Copies the active initramfs and compares both checksum and byte-level hex output to detect unauthorized modifications.
rationale_steps: Copy the initramfs image using dd for consistent block-level reads.
Compute MD5 checksums for a quick comparison against a baseline.
Use od to produce hex dumps and perform a unified diff for precise change visualization.
